intro: Kadua grandis, commonly known as the large kadua, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stem and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and elliptical, with a smooth surface. Kadua grandis is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
